intro: Acrostichum brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed brake, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Dennstaedtiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a leathery texture. Acrostichum brevipes plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
